captions.text: [SOUND] Welcome,
everyone.
My name is Ali-A.

Today, we are going to be talking about
how old cooler shooting maps could be

returning in the future for
Advanced Warfare.
What it's gonna mean?
What kind of maps we can expect and

this is also hinting generally at
the future of DOC for Advanced Warfare.

So Sledgehammer Games
guys are developing and

have made Call of Duty Advanced Warfare,
came out and said the following.

One new piece of feedback,
we have heard in Havoc,

which is of course the first DOC map
pack for Advanced Warfare is the fan

desire to see some classic maps make
their way into Advanced Warfare.

And we're talking about looking into
opportunities to really highlight

the vertical game play mechanics
in some reimagined franchise

favorites moving forward, like we did with
Atlas Gorge, which is very exciting news.

For those of you guys that don't know the
first Havoc map pack for Advanced Warfare

did not include any old maps at all that
had four brand new multiplayer maps.
It is now available on PlayStation Four.

It was available last month for
Xbox users and will be available very,
very soon for PC.

I know it has been delayed a little
bit for PC for some reason.

Now, in terms of those multiplayer maps
that you get within the multiplayer packs.

In previous, Call of Duty games,
we're used to getting three new maps and

the fourth one being
a reimagined multiplayer map.

Now some people that I heard from you guys
talking on Twitter have said that you like

the idea of getting four new maps,
because it's brand new pieces of content.

But then of course, there's people that
love to see the old Call of Duty maps

return and it's even reimagined and
changed a little bit.

We have seen Atlas Gorge
returning from Call of Duty Four.
It's a big remake of Pipeline.

I actually played it
literally like last week.

I'll leave the video link down below
if you haven't seen it already and
want to check that map out.

But you've got to realize that you
can't simply just take them out from

previous Call of Duty games and
put it into Advanced Warfare,

because of the new double jumping feature
that could literally break the map if it
isn't implemented correctly.

Because if you can jump too high, you can
literally glitch on top of buildings and

be really high in the air and
look across the whole map.

But some maps don't have any
verticality to them at all.

You would just be running around as if
you're playing a normal Call of Duty map

and it's not really gonna
be switched up very much.

So, I've gone ahead and looked through the
sort of paths the Call of Duty games and

looked at the maps that I think could
work well with the Exo abilities,

which would allow you to get up to
places easier with the Exo suit, but

wouldn't allow you to
glitch into weird places.

Going all the way back
to Modern Warfare Two,
I think Quarry would be a fantastic map.
It has very high vertical buildings.

And of course,
has those huge cement blocks and

rather having to climb up them each time
you can simply double jump up them and

I think this would work very,
very well with the Exo abilities.

Make the map feel a lot quicker and
faster and

could definitely fit in
with Advanced Warfare.
Moving forwards to Black OPs One.
I think Jungle would fit in quite well.

There are a few high spots
you could get up to,

which you normally have to climb ladders
to get to with the double jump feature,
you could simply jump straight up there.

Again, there shouldn't really be
any places you could glitch onto or
jump too high on to.

I think again,
it is speed up the pace of the map.

And honestly, I absolutely love
drone goofing backups one, so
I would love to see it return anyway.

Moving forward again to
Modern Warfare Three,

these maps are a little bit weird and I,
it was definitely harder to choose one

that I think would fit in well with
the double jumps, but I think possibly sea

town could be a very good map that would
work well within Advanced Warfare.

Think again, it's like to get up to those
upper levels a little bit quicker rather
than having to go up the stairs.

And means that you have
to keep an eye out for

those people who may be
double jumping everywhere.
But again, it would fit in really well.

I've tried to choose maps that haven't
already been reused in previous Call of

Duty games again,
cuz typically if they remake a map,

they don't then remake it again for
a future game.
So moving forward into black ops too.

Again, I think cargo
would work quite well.

You've got all of the big
cargo containers and

rather than having to walk around
the edge to get up to them,

you can double jump on top of them,
double jump around them.

Perhaps, this would lead to
some slightly crazy lines and

sights if you can double jump all the way
on top of the cargo boxes potentially, but
I think it'd be very interesting.

It would definitely switch up the way that
it was played back in black ops two and

it'd be very different
within Advanced Warfare.
So let me know what you guys think.
Do you like to see old maps return or

would you rather have four
brand new multiplayer maps for

each DLC pack that we're going to
be getting for Advanced Warfare?

What do you think, could my four
multiplayer map suggestions that could be
returning in Advanced Warfare?

Maybe you've got your own favorite
map that you'd like to see return and

could work really well
with the double jump.

I'll keep you guys updated
with all the latest DOC news.

Of course, for Advanced Warfare, you know,
I've got your back all the time.
So make sure you are subscribing.

If you've enjoyed the video,
give it a thumbs up and
check out more on screen here.

I'm continuing to play through a brand
new game called Stranded Deep over on my
second channel and I ran into a shock.

So, if you want to see that,
you can check it out on screen here.
Thank you so much for watching and

I'll see you guys tomorrow as
always with a brand new video.

title: "OLD MAPS RETURNING!" - Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare DLC

comments.author: Alexander Lopez R

comments.text:
Favorite number 1: Seatown from MW3! Would love to be able to get on the 
beams over the streets and to jump on some of the smaller buildings. I 
think it would be really hectic gameplay on all game modes.

Alternatives for Seatown for me are: Mission and Underground. Also MW3. 
I've played every CoD since CoD 2 and these bring back the best hectic and 
exciting gameplay memories. Because of the height differences these are my 
absolute favorites to get enhanced with double jumping.﻿
